## ğŸš€ Description

Please provide a detailed, high-level summary of your changes. What problem does this PR solve, and what is the high-level goal?

## ğŸ”— Related Issue

This PR is related to:

-   Fixes # (replace with issue number, e.g., `Fixes #123`)
-   [Optional] Related issue/discussion: [LINK]

## ğŸ› ï¸ Type of Change

Please delete options that are not relevant.

-   [ ] **Bug fix** (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
-   [ ] **New feature** (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
-   [ ] **Breaking change** (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
-   [ ] **Refactoring** (Code structure/clean up change that doesn't fix a bug or add a feature)
-   [ ] **Documentation update**
-   [ ] **Other** (Specify: )

## âœ… How Has This Been Tested?

Please describe the tests that you ran to verify your changes. Provide instructions or context so the reviewer can reproduce the tests if necessary.

-   [ ] **Manual/Visual Tests:** (e.g., "Tested on Chrome and Firefox.")
-   [ ] **Unit Tests:** (e.g., "All existing unit tests pass, and new tests were added for component X.")
-   [ ] **No Testing Required:** (e.g., purely documentation or config change)

If your changes involve visual elements (UI, UX, components), please include before and after screenshots or a short GIF/video recording.

| Before | After |

## ğŸ“‹ Checklist

*Please check off all that apply and include a brief explanation if necessary.*

-   [ ] My code follows the style guidelines of this project (linters pass).
-   [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code.
-   [ ] I have added/updated documentation (if applicable).
-   [ ] New and existing tests pass locally with my changes.
-   [ ] I have **@mentions** the person or team responsible for reviewing proposed changes.
-   [ ] I have checked my changes against the **target branch** to ensure no conflicts.
